str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A centurion of the Roman army. Or hekatontarchos hek-at-on'-tar-khos; from hekaton and archo; the captain of one hundred men.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A flat roof of a house. Strengthened from a primary tegos; a roof.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Perhaps from paio; a boy, or, a girl, and a child; specially, a slave or servant.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.
